<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 13"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scope of Truth](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1216)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 182 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters with access to firearms gain access to accessories that can be used with those weapons. Replace the word "transmutation" in the scope of truth with the word "polymorph."_

**Price** 3,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** attached to firearm or crossbow (scope)

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The _scope of truth_ is a bit bigger than most to accommodate larger lenses, which have been magically prepared with tiny shards from crystal balls to reveal the truth. The scope grants you a +2 item bonus to Perception checks made to [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) in areas you can see through the scope.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> Interact;  **Frequency** once per day;   **Effect** For the next 10 minutes, you can see things through the scope as they actually are. The GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) check with a +20 counteract modifier and a counteract level of 7 against any [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) or [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157) in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it, not to end the spell or effect. For instance, if the check succeeds against a [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the spell.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
